info.title: NetworkCloud
info.description: The Network Cloud APIs provide management of the Azure Operator Nexus compute resources such as on-premises clusters, hardware resources, and workload infrastructure resources.

get.summary: Retrieve the operation status.
get.description: Get the properties of the provided operation status.

parameters.name: operationStatusId
parameters.description: The ID of the operation status.

put.summary: Create or update the operation status.

parameters.description: The ID of the operation status.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description: The ETag of the transformation. Omit this value to always overwrite the current resource. Specify the last-seen ETag value to prevent accidentally overwriting concurrent changes.

parameters.name: if-none-match
parameters.description: Set to '*' to allow a new record set to be created, but to prevent updating an existing resource. Other values will result in error from server as they are not supported.

parameters.description: The request body.

ipv4Address.description: The IPv4 address associated with the endpoint.

ipv6Address.description: The IPv6 address associated with the endpoint.

detailedStatus.description: The detailed status reported by the access bridge.

detailedStatusMessage.description: The descriptive message that accompanies the detailed status.

endpoints.description: The observed endpoints that clients should use to reach the access bridge.

ipv4ConnectedPrefix.description: The IPv4 subnet from which the access bridge allocates an address. This subnet must be part of the internal network specified by networkId.

ipv6ConnectedPrefix.description: The IPv6 subnet from which the access bridge allocates an address. This subnet must be part of the internal network specified by networkId.

networkId.description: The resource ID of the internal network in a layer 3 isolation domain containing the IP subnets to use.

protocol.description: The protocol advertised by the access bridge endpoints.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the access bridge.

securityRules.description: The list of security rules enforced by the access bridge.

AccessBridgeProvisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the access bridge.

AccessBridgeSecurityRule.description: AccessBridgeSecurityRule captures an individual access rule enforced by the bridge.

description.description: The user provided value describing this rule.

direction.description: The direction of allowed network traffic based on the rule. Inbound indicates network traffic flowing to the on-premises cluster.

ipv4Addresses.description: The set of IPv4 addresses permitted as the source or destination of the security rule. For as single address, utilize a /32 (CIDR notation). One or both Ipv4Addresses and Ipv6Addresses must be specified. Example formats: 10.10.10.10-10.10.10.20 or 10.10.10.10/24.

ipv6Addresses.description: The set of IPv6 addresses permitted as the source or destination of the security rule. For as single address, utilize a /128 (CIDR notation). One or both Ipv4Addresses and Ipv6Addresses must be specified. Example formats: 2001:db8:abcd::1-2001:db8:abcd::ff or 2001:db8:abcd::1/64.

port.description: The source or destination port or port range. Example 24562 or 24562-24570.

ActionState.description: ActionState represents the state of an action taken against a resource. This can be used to represent both explicitly and implicitly defined action types.

actionType.description: The representation of the action for which this is a status. Matches ARM resource action format when the action is an ARM-based action.

correlationId.description: The correlation ID for the original action request. Omitted if there is no related correlation ID.

endTime.description: The timestamp of when the action reached its final, terminal state. Uses ISO 8601 format.

message.description: The description providing additional context for the status value. May be empty or contain guidance in the case of a failure.

startTime.description: The timestamp of when the action began, in ISO 8601 format.

stepStates.description: The ordered list of the individual steps which make up the action.

AdministrativeCredentials.description: AdministrativeCredentials represents the admin credentials for the device requiring password-based authentication.

password.description: The password of the administrator of the device used during initialization.

passwordRef.description: PasswordReference contains the reference to the source of a password.

username.description: The username of the administrator of the device used during initialization.

AdministratorConfiguration.description: AdministratorConfiguration represents the administrative credentials that will be applied to the control plane and agent pool nodes in Kubernetes clusters.

adminUsername.description: The user name for the administrator that will be applied to the operating systems that run Kubernetes nodes. If not supplied, a user name will be chosen by the service.

sshPublicKeys.description: The SSH configuration for the operating systems that run the nodes in the Kubernetes cluster. In some cases, specification of public keys may be required to produce a working environment.

AdministratorConfigurationPatch.description: AdministratorConfigurationPatch represents the patching capabilities for the administrator configuration.

sshPublicKeys.description: SshPublicKey represents the public key used to authenticate with a resource through SSH.

AgentPoolMode.description: The selection of how this agent pool is utilized, either as a system pool or a user pool. System pools run the features and critical services for the Kubernetes Cluster, while user pools are dedicated to user workloads. Every Kubernetes cluster must contain at least one system node pool with at least one node.

AgentPoolPatchParameters.description: AgentPoolPatchParameters represents the body of the request to patch the Kubernetes cluster agent pool.

tags.description: The Azure resource tags that will replace the existing ones.

count.description: The number of virtual machines that use this configuration.

upgradeSettings.description: The configuration of the agent pool.

AgentPoolProperties.description: AgentPoolProperties represents the properties of the Kubernetes cluster agent pool.

administratorConfiguration.description: The administrator credentials to be used for the nodes in this agent pool.

agentOptions.description: The configurations that will be applied to each agent in this agent pool.

attachedNetworkConfiguration.description: The configuration of networks being attached to the agent pool for use by the workloads that run on this Kubernetes cluster.

availabilityZones.description: The list of availability zones of the Network Cloud cluster used for the provisioning of nodes in this agent pool. If not specified, all availability zones will be used.

count.description: The number of virtual machines that use this configuration.

detailedStatus.description: The current status of the agent pool.

detailedStatusMessage.description: The descriptive message about the current detailed status.

kubernetesVersion.description: The Kubernetes version running in this agent pool.

labels.description: The labels applied to the nodes in this agent pool.

mode.description: The selection of how this agent pool is utilized, either as a system pool or a user pool. System pools run the features and critical services for the Kubernetes Cluster, while user pools are dedicated to user workloads. Every Kubernetes cluster must contain at least one system node pool with at least one node.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the agent pool.

taints.description: The taints applied to the nodes in this agent pool.

upgradeSettings.description: The configuration of the agent pool.

vmSkuName.description: The name of the VM SKU that determines the size of resources allocated for node VMs.

AgentPoolProvisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the agent pool.

AgentPoolUpgradeSettings.description: AgentPoolUpgradeSettings specifies the upgrade settings for an agent pool.

drainTimeout.description: The maximum time in seconds that is allowed for a node drain to complete before proceeding with the upgrade of the agent pool. If not specified during creation, a value of 1800 seconds is used.

maxSurge.description: The maximum number or percentage of nodes that are surged during upgrade. This can either be set to an integer (e.g. '5') or a percentage (e.g. '50%'). If a percentage is specified, it is the percentage of the total agent pool size at the time of the upgrade. For percentages, fractional nodes are rounded up. If not specified during creation, a value of 1 is used. One of MaxSurge and MaxUnavailable must be greater than 0.

maxUnavailable.description: The maximum number or percentage of nodes that can be unavailable during upgrade. This can either be set to an integer (e.g. '5') or a percentage (e.g. '50%'). If a percentage is specified, it is the percentage of the total agent pool size at the time of the upgrade. For percentages, fractional nodes are rounded up. If not specified during creation, a value of 0 is used. One of MaxSurge and MaxUnavailable must be greater than 0.

AnalyticsOutputSettings.description: AnalyticsOutputSettings represents the settings for the log analytics workspace used for output of logs from this cluster.

associatedIdentity.description: The selection of the managed identity to use with this analytics workspace. The identity type must be either system assigned or user assigned.

vmUid.description: The VM UID is a generated unique ID created for the node VM which is used for arc enrolling the HybridCompute during the azcmagent connect existing process. This is used to correlate the HybridCompute with the NAKS node VM.

limitTimeSeconds.description: The maximum time the script is allowed to run. If the execution time exceeds the maximum, the script will be stopped, any output produced until then will be captured, and the exit code matching a timeout will be returned (252).

script.description: The base64 encoded script to execute on the bare metal machine.

limitTimeSeconds.description: The maximum time the commands are allowed to run. If the execution time exceeds the maximum, the script will be stopped, any output produced until then will be captured, and the exit code matching a timeout will be returned (252).

limitTimeSeconds.description: The maximum time the commands are allowed to run. If the execution time exceeds the maximum, the script will be stopped, any output produced until then will be captured, and the exit code matching a timeout will be returned (252).

NetworkAttachment.description: NetworkAttachment represents the single network attachment.

attachedNetworkId.description: The resource ID of the associated network attached to the virtual machine. It can be one of cloudServicesNetwork, l3Network, l2Network or trunkedNetwork resources.

defaultGateway.description: The indicator of whether this is the default gateway. Only one of the attached networks (including the CloudServicesNetwork attachment) for a single machine may be specified as True.

ipAllocationMethod.description: The IP allocation mechanism for the virtual machine. Dynamic and Static are only valid for l3Network which may also specify Disabled. Otherwise, Disabled is the only permitted value.

ipv4Address.description: The IPv4 address of the virtual machine.  This field is used only if the attached network has IPAllocationType of IPV4 or DualStack.  If IPAllocationMethod is: Static - this field must contain a user specified IPv4 address from within the subnet specified in the attached network. Dynamic - this field is read-only, but will be populated with an address from within the subnet specified in the attached network. Disabled - this field will be empty.

ipv6Address.description: The IPv6 address of the virtual machine.  This field is used only if the attached network has IPAllocationType of IPV6 or DualStack.  If IPAllocationMethod is: Static - this field must contain an IPv6 address range from within the range specified in the attached network. Dynamic - this field is read-only, but will be populated with an range from within the subnet specified in the attached network. Disabled - this field will be empty.

macAddress.description: The MAC address of the interface for the virtual machine that corresponds to this network attachment.

networkAttachmentName.description: The associated network's interface name. If specified, the network attachment name has a maximum length of 15 characters and must be unique to this virtual machine. If the user doesnt specify this value, the default interface name of the network resource will be used. For a CloudServicesNetwork resource, this name will be ignored.

serviceCidrs.description: The CIDR notation IP ranges from which to assign service IPs. One IPv4 CIDR is expected for single-stack networking. Two CIDRs, one for each IP family (IPv4/IPv6), is expected for dual-stack networking.

keepAliveTime.description: Field Deprecated. The field was previously optional, now it will have no defined behavior and will be ignored. The requested BGP keepalive time value. This field uses ISO 8601 duration format, for example P1H.

name.description: The name used to identify this BGP peer for association with a BGP advertisement.

password.description: The authentication password for routers enforcing TCP MD5 authenticated sessions.

passwordRef.description: PasswordReference contains the reference to the source of a password.

peerAddress.description: The IPv4 or IPv6 address used to connect this BGP session.

passwordRef.description: PasswordReference contains the reference to the source of a password.

StepState.description: StepState represents the state of a step in an action.

endTime.description: The timestamp for when processing of the step reached its terminal state, in ISO 8601 format.

message.description: The message providing additional context for the status value. May be empty, or contain diagnostic information in the case of a failure.

startTime.description: The timestamp for when processing of the step began, in ISO 8601 format.

status.description: The status of the step. A value of Completed or Failed indicates a terminal state for the step.

StepStateStatus.description: The status of the step. A value of Completed or Failed indicates a terminal state for the step.
